image.altText: A woman takes a photo from a boat of an erupting volcano

items.synopsis: The criminal trial over the 2019 eruption of Whakaari White Island volcano while 42 tourists and five tour guides were in its crater hears an allegation that the brothers who own it decided not to pay for expert risk assessments.

title.children: Whakaari volcano owners 'profited from every single tourist' before eruption, NZ court hears

image.altText: BRS

items.synopsis: A judge dismissed his defamation proceedings last month in a judgement that was more than 700 pages long.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith to appeal after losing landmark defamation case

image.altText: A man walks past a bed of flowers outside the entrance to Crown Casino.

items.synopsis: Crown's fine is the third largest in Australian corporate history, behind payments made by Westpac ($1.3 billion) and the Commonwealth Bank ($700 million).

title.children: Crown Resorts ordered to pay $450 million fine for breaching money laundering laws

image.altText: A sign on a building that reads: The Children's Hospital at Westmead

items.synopsis: A clinic at Westmead Children's Hospital has only seen three new patients this year and is struggling to operate in the wake of a string of staff resignations.

title.children: Review announced into delivery of gender-affirming care in NSW following Four Corners investigation

image.altText: Stephen Jones sits at a desk. He wears a suit. A large bookcase is behind him.

items.synopsis: The United Kingdom will force banks to compensate scam victims under a world-first scheme, and Australia's financial services minister now says he's considering similar rules here.

title.children: Minister indicates Australia could follow UK and force banks to reimburse scam victims

image.altText: Nick Moore

items.synopsis: The "cliff" is here or approaching for more than a million mortgage borrowers, many of whom will see their repayments jump by thousands of dollars a month.

title.children: 'You're talking about some people paying 3 or 4 per cent more on their mortgage ... overnight'

image.altText: A large brick building bearing an emblem and the name "St Joseph's Catholic College".

items.synopsis: The death of the Central Coast teenager, who is being remembered as a "true friend", comes amid a spike in influenza-related hospital admissions in NSW.

title.children: Well-loved year 9 girl dies weeks after catching influenza

image.altText: A picture of the tiktok logo, which looks like a musical note, with a silhouette of a person holding a phone.

items.synopsis: A senate committee slams TikTok for not answering simple questions as the company gives limited evidence about Chinese employees accessing Australian users' data.

title.children: TikTok executive tells parliamentary inquiry they don't know location of own headquarters

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: More than three years after Whakaari White Island erupted and killed 22 people, New Zealand's workplace health and safety regulator will bring the owners of the volcano and several tours companies to court.

title.children: Three brothers own the NZ volcano that killed 17 Australians. Today their trial begins

image.altText: A crane looms above a multi-storey construction site covered in scaffolding.

items.synopsis: NSW Work Health and Safety Minister Sophie Cotsis says there is "absolutely no excuse" for noncompliance as stop work orders are issued at two construction sites in the city.

title.children: 'Shocker' construction sites in Newcastle shut down as officials blast alleged safety failures

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

items.synopsis: A teen who is seeking home detention after pleading guilty to terror offences, including possessing information for a terrorist attack, shows a "sympathy towards ISIS" which "has not diminished", an Adelaide court hears.

title.children: Teenager overheard saying he 'would do something' at Anzac service next year, court told

image.altText: A mine site in bushland, as seen from above.

items.synopsis: South32 will pay almost $2.9 million after an investigation found it had been taking two Olympic pools' worth of water from Sydney's catchment per day for the last five years.

title.children: Mining company agrees to record payout after admitting to draining millions of litres from Sydney water supply

image.altText: A smiling elderly woman with short, white hair.

items.synopsis: The civil matter has been listed under Clare Nowland's name. The 95-year-old died in hospital earlier this year after falling and hitting her head following the alleged incident with a police officer.

title.children: Family of great-grandmother who died after allegedly being tasered by police sues NSW

image.altText: The father and son of a Russian soldier mourn his death. They are standing by his casket, crying.

items.synopsis: Nearly 50,000 Russian men have died in the war in Ukraine, according to the first independent statistical analysis of data to learn the true human cost of Russia's invasion.

title.children: Moscow's closest-held secret revealed by new data about Russia's death toll in Ukraine war

image.altText: Commissioner Catherine Holmes, ex pm Scott Morrison, ex ministers Alan Tudge and Stuart Robert, bureaucrat Kathryn Campbell

items.synopsis: Gordon Legal says it is considering a fresh compensation claim, telling the ABC the royal commission has brought to light new evidence that was not previously available.

title.children: Law firm that led Robodebt class action considers fresh compensation claim after royal commission

image.altText: An elevated view of a construction site at night. It is lit up with spotlights. Debris is strewn around and workers can be seen.

items.synopsis: Rescue crews say no-one else is trapped under the rubble, which is expected to take several more days to clear.

title.children: At least two killed, several injured as elevated road collapses in Bangkok

image.altText: Chau Van Kham, centre, pictured with his wife Trang and Chris Bowen.

items.synopsis: Vietnam frees Australian man Chau Van Kham who was detained in 2019 and sentenced to 12 years in prison on terrorism charges.

title.children: 'Absolutely emotional': Sydney man freed from Vietnam prison and returned to Australia

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man.

items.synopsis: Victoria Police has offered a $1 million reward for information that helps solve the murder of Robert "Jack" Richardson nearly 40 years ago and say DNA evidence could lead to breakthroughs in the case.

title.children: 'Jack' Richardson missed his court date in 1984. He was found murdered execution-style weeks later

image.altText: Craig Kelly addresses a group of journalists.

items.synopsis: A Federal Court judge criticises the Australian Electoral Commission's conduct in a dispute with former federal MP Craig Kelly about his 2022 election campaign posters.

title.children: 'The theft was rife': Craig Kelly in court over federal campaign poster dispute

image.altText: A man walks off then field while being clapped by opposition players.

items.synopsis: Wallabies halfback Nic White says the Aussies are finding positives in their massive loss to the Springboks, a game he describes as a "bitter pill to swallow".

title.children: 'There were some positives out there': Wallabies look for silver lining after Springboks nightmare

image.altText: A young blue heeler stands in brown water in the Pilbara

items.synopsis: Drones, infrared cameras and the goodwill of volunteers help in the search for a blue heeler who went missing after a remote car rollover near Coral Bay.

title.children: Clancy the blue heeler survives a week in the bush after car rollover in remote WA

image.altText: The walls of a youth detention centre through a barbed wire fence. A sign partially obscured by grass says 'no entry'.

items.synopsis: The Supreme Court of Western Australia finds three young detainees were subjected to "solitary confinement on a frequent basis" and were unlawfully locked in their cells at Banksia Hill Detention Centre and Unit 18 for prolonged periods.

title.children: 'Systemic failure': WA youth detainees 'unlawfully confined' during lockdowns, court finds

image.altText: a photo of a man sitting at a small table in a caravan

items.synopsis: Residents are wondering where they will go, after they were asked to leave their homes at a Bendigo caravan park with just two weeks' notice.

title.children: Permanent residents of caravan park given weeks to find new homes after developer buys property

image.altText: Angus Beaumont who was stabbed to death in a Redcliffe park, smiling and wearing a beanie

items.synopsis: Angus Beaumont died after he was stabbed in the chest in Redcliffe in March 2020.

title.children: Teenage killers of Queensland 15-year-old suffered 'miscarriage of justice' and will be retried, court rules

image.altText: Two penguins stand on rocks in a paddling pool

items.synopsis: Fiordland penguins rarely make landfall on the Australian continent, so a recent influx has a researcher concerned about tough feeding conditions.

title.children: Rare penguins' Aussie arrival not a good sign, researcher says

image.altText: Woman in jeans, maroon top and white sneakers sitting down on stairs.

items.synopsis: A woman is seeking compensation from the Tasmanian government and a netball association over the sexual abuse she suffered at the hands of notorious paedophile nurse James Geoffrey Griffin.

title.children: Sexual abuse survivor suing government, sporting organisation, after abuse by paedophile nurse

image.altText: Two men celebrate after winning a State of Origin match

items.synopsis: Josh Reynolds's Origin career only lasted four games but his time in the sky-blue jersey explains a key difference between New South Wales and Queensland, writes Nick Campton.

title.children: The Josh Reynolds factor and why the Blues still don't get Origin like Queenslanders do

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and German Chancellor Scholz review the troops in Berlin

items.synopsis: Australia has agreed to join the German-led Climate Club. What is the club and will it make any difference to the nation's climate goals?

title.children: Why has Australia signed up to Germany's Climate Club and what difference will it make?

image.altText: A dead crocodile is laid out onto a table with its mouth being held open by a man

items.synopsis: The saltwater crocodile involved in an attack at Wangi Falls in the Northern Territory has been killed, while the 67-year-old victim remains in hospital in Darwin.

title.children: Crocodile shot and killed after man hospitalised in attack at Top End waterhole

image.altText: aerial picture of remote roadhouse with 4WDs parked out front

items.synopsis: After nearly two decades serving up their famous enormous burgers, rescuing dozens of stranded motorists and seeing a three-fold increase in traffic, the owners of one of Australia's most remote roadhouses have handed over the keys.

title.children: End of an era as remote roadhouse changes hands for first time in 18 years

image.altText: blonde aflw player lighting weights in a gym

items.synopsis: Players are pushing for an increase in the number of rounds each season, fairer pay, and enhanced job security.

title.children: Some athletes work full-time and do months of prep for just 10 games. A new deal could bring them closer to professionalism
